question.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>RNA</mi></math> interference is used for which of the following purposes in the field of biotechnology?

options.text: To develop a plant tolerant to abiotic stresses
To develop a pest resistant plant against infestation by nematode
To enhance the mineral usage by the plant

solution.text: RNAi or RNA interference or anti-sense RNA is a naturally occurring mechanism that leads to the “silencing” of genes. In consequence, the respective protein is no longer synthesized. Several nematodes parasitize a wide variety of plants. A nematode Meloidogyne incognita infects the roots of tobacco plants causing a great reduction in yield.  The most cost-effective and sustainable management tactic for preventing such damage is by using RNAi mechanism by developing genetically engineered or transgenic plants.
